occupation: AVP, Learning and Development at American Auto Shield
headline: AVP, Learning and Development at American Auto Shield
summary:
Strategic leader of corporate wide learning opportunities and experienced at developing and implementing strategic training initiatives to increase organizational performance. Proven track record in building and developing high functioning training teams and departments and establishing training deployments across internal and external audiences. Goal-directed coach and mentor with expertise in facilitation, communication, curriculum development, and team development. Highly adept in applying adult learning principles and creating dynamic, motivated, and meaningful learning experiences including.

Core competencies include:
- Define and execute training strategy and vision
- People leader
- Global leadership
- Leadership development, coaching, and mentoring
- Create and manage budgetary requirements
- Learning Management System implementation and administration
- Superior facilitation, training, and instructional design skills, including eLearning
-  Exceptional knowledge and application of both ADDIE model and Adult Learning Principles
- Project and stakeholder management
- Predictive Index Practitioner

experiences.title: AVP, Learning and Development
experiences.description: Built the entire L&D function from the beginning including structure, jobs, processes, guidelines, and content to support the growing company. Created the strategy and tactical plan for a scalable and agile function capable of delivering world-class training for 10 – 80 new hire learners with minimal notice in a virtual environment multiple times a month. Establish collaborative relationships across the organization to build and deliver the required new hire training in addition to the ongoing development training needed for all levels of the growing organization.

experiences.title: Head of Training and Quality
experiences.description: Develop the strategy and tactical plan to align the new Training and Quality Department with the evolving business operating model of company. Establish a new training and Quality Assurance model to effectively train and monitor all lines of business in the call center. Establish Change Management processes to ensure new model business model is readily adapted.

experiences.title: Customer and Support Training Manager, North America
experiences.description:
Direct North American training organization and implemented instructional design and facilitation standards. Developed and executed strategic plan to create standardized, high-quality training experiences for new and existing support agents. Managed a team of 7 direct reports, 10 virtual reports, and 30 vendor trainers and instructional designers. Formed collaborative and strategic partnerships across all Pearson geographies and larger international community to create virtual global training community. 

- Created 3-year training strategy, simplifying efficiency and budget, increasing employee performance.
- Implemented Speed to Competency metrics to quantify training performance, improving initial metric by 25% and increasing competency by 60 days.
- Streamlined training courses and shortening training time by 25%.

experiences.title: Manager of Training
experiences.description:
Provide overall strategy and vision to drive training initiatives to attain all company goals, while building external and internal partnerships. Create and implement a professional development program for all levels of the organization to build bench strength of internal leadership. Establish a high-quality external training program that educates external customers in the methods, technology, and practices of NCM. Establish a collaborative relationship between NCM departments and external business partners.   

- Implemented Master Train the Trainer program to improve facilitation skills of training team, increasing evaluation scores 50% in 6 months and increasing customer training survey scores 30%.
- Identified and implemented 2 Learning Management Systems allowing employees in remote locations to receive ongoing professional development while decreasing travel to corporate office.

experiences.title: Senior Trainer
experiences.description:
Established a global end-user training program for government proprietary logistics software used by military and civilian personnel. Applied adult learning principles to create relevant and specific training classes that allowed participants to implement new strategies for day-to-day procedures.

- Maintained an average evaluation score of 98% over a 5-year period.
- Identified several cost-saving improvement measures that were implemented by military units worldwide; savings as much as 25% in overall spending.
- Invited to teach at NATO, premier aviation and logistics conferences.
experiences.location: OPTIMUS Corp/Private Contract for Department of Defense

certifications.name: Certified Professional in Talent Development
certifications.authority: ATD CI - The ATD Certification Institute
